lines.text:
[to Tufts]
Shakin' hands with an Indian's like pumpin' a well!

[Referring to Judy]
I take her to be a lady of quality.
Why? Because she has a servant?
You just didn't didn't come over here to pass the time of day. W-what's troublin' your mind?
Well, since you ask, I'm a little curious to know if I'm gonna get out of here alive.
Why should you know more than anyone else?
Because I've got a lot to do. I've made too many plans for too long a time to have them all end up in a swamp.
Well, all I can tell you to ease your mind is that I don't intend to commit suicide.

[tiring of the diet]
Fish and turtles! Nothing but fish and turtles! I'm about to grow gills!
These injuns smell a little gamey, Captain. They rub skunk oil on themselves to keep off bugs and flies.

An interesting thing about the way the Seminoles bury their warriors. The sit 'em up and put war paint on 'em, set a bowl of fresh food alongside of 'em and then stick their favorite weapon in their hands and then they cover 'em up. With a great chief like that over yonder, they throw in the first newborn child to be born after he died.
Why do they do a thing like that for?

Well, they believe when a man dies, his spirit leaves the body and enters that of the first newborn. And in regarding a chief that high like that, they don't want the spirit to be passed on down to somebody that ain't fit to carry it.
They still don't like fightin' at night. But they'll come a hootin' and a hollerin' at dawn!
It makes me fonder than ever of moonshine.
You know, you can't go through life trying to get even. You know, you can't carry a grudge forever.
